title: Who'll win? Flipper Zero or Door Lock?
transcript: Flipper Zero versus door lock who's gonna win? Notice here I've got a lock it uses a remote control we're told by the manufacturer on the box that it has an encrypted roll code that means I shouldn't be able to capture the signal and replay it but let's put it to the test. On the Flipper zero I can go to sub gigahertz select that and then select read raw before I do that I will lock the lock and what I'm going to do is I'm going to capture the unlock signal I'm going to press record so it's busy recording and I'll press unlock. I've captured that signal now. So in theory when I lock this lock I shouldn't be able to unlock it using the flipper zero but let's test it. So I'll send the signal notice door is unlocked I'll lock it again, send the signal using the flipper zero once again. I personally would be very
